intro: Anthospermum spathulatum subsp. ecklonianum, commonly known as the Ecklon's anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
